SEARCH

Class CDService

java.lang.Object
CDService
public class CDService extends Object
Service class that manages CDs in the library system. Provides functionality to add, find, borrow, return, and persist CDs to and from files.
Version:
1.0
Author:
hoor

      public CDService()

  • Method Details

    • addCD

      public void addCD(CD cd)
      Adds a new CD to the collection.
      Parameters:
      cd - the CD to add

    • findById

      public CD findById(String id)
      Finds a CD by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the CD ID
      Returns:
      the CD object, or null if not found

    • borrowCD

      public void borrowCD(Member member, String cdId)
      Allows a member to borrow a CD. The loan period is handled inside the CD class (7 days).
      Parameters:
      member - the member borrowing the CD
      cdId - the ID of the CD to borrow
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the CD is not found
      IllegalStateException - if the CD is already borrowed or the member has unpaid fines

    • returnCD

      public void returnCD(Member member, String cdId)
      Allows a member to return a borrowed CD.
      Parameters:
      member - the member returning the CD
      cdId - the ID of the CD to return
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the CD is not found
      IllegalStateException - if the CD is not currently borrowed

    • getAllCDs

      public Collection<CD> getAllCDs()
      Gets all CDs in the collection.
      Returns:
      a collection of all CDs

    • saveCDs

      public void saveCDs(String filename) throws IOException
      Saves all CDs to a file. Each line is written in the format: id,title,artist,status where status is either "available" or "borrowed:memberId".
      Parameters:
      filename - the file to save to
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing

    • loadCDs

      public void loadCDs(String filename) throws IOException
      Loads CDs from a file. Each line should be in the format: id,title,artist,status where status is either "available" or "borrowed:memberId".
      Parameters:
      filename - the file to load from
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading
